title: 'What a great afternoon!' Naomi Watt's ex-partner Liev Schriber takes their son Kai to the ballet
text:
American actor Liev Schreiber took his son Samuel Kai to the ballet on Sunday.

Experiencing a backstage tour courtesy of the American Ballet Theatre, the father-son duo said they enjoyed a 'great afternoon'.

The Ray Donovan star, 52, shared a photo with his long-haired child with Principal Dancer, Misty Copeland.

'What a great afternoon!' Naomi Watt's ex-partner Liev Schriber takes their son Kai to the ballet

Samuel, who goes by middle name Kai, smiled while wearing a long-sleeve grey shirt and jeans.

Liev shares custody of Kai, 11, with Australian ex-partner Naomi Watts, 51, whom he split with in 2016.

The former couple also have an older son, 12-year-old Sasha Schreiber.

Proud dad! Samuel, who goes by middle name Kai, is regularly featured on Liev's social media

Naomi is often seen out and about in New York, where she is based, with her sons.

Kai has been spotted on numerous occasions dressed in dresses, skirts and feminine colours.

In July 2017, father Liev attended the San Diego Comic-Con with Kai dressed as Harley Quinn from 'Suicide Squad'.

Family life: Liev shares custody of Kai, 11, and Sasha, 12, with Australian ex-partner Naomi Watts, 51, whom he split with in 2016

Speaking to the August issue of Harper's Bazaar this year, Naomi revealed how their break-up changed the family dynamic.

The English-born actress said that she and Liev, who were never married, are 'better friends' now than when they were together.

'Liev and I always knew we had to put the kids first and that, no matter what, we would respect each other and take care of each other in the best way going forward for the benefit of our children,' she said.

'And we've kept things in a great space. We're easy with each other and we want the best for each other. Our friendship is better now than it ever was.'
description: American actor Liev Schreiber took his son Samuel Kai to the ballet on Sunday.
authors: Candice Jackson For Daily Mail Australia
